result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody T Goodbear

Defendant Cody T Goodbear appeared by video.  Attorney Kathleen A Kruse appeared by video for Cody T Goodbear.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody T Goodbear appeared by video.  Attorney Kathleen A Kruse appeared by video for Cody T Goodbear.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has all discovery and offer. Needs additional time to review with client. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody T Goodbear in court with attorney Kathleen A Kruse.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody T Goodbear appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and needs time to review.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cody T Goodbear in court with attorney Kathleen A Kruse.  Defendant Cody T Goodbear in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody T Goodbear appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
